title: I am unbanned!
body:
I was recently banned for 14 days due to a missunderstanding (which the support also agreed on)
Took 9 days to handle the situation but I am finally unbanned and my honor level is restored.

Thanks to the support that worked on my ticket with broken german. I appreciate that you communicated with me in a language you are not so familiar with.

I've never been banned or suspended (mostly because if I rage I'll just yell at my cat or something, I'll never bother fueling a fire by typing in chat). However, I'm pretty curious about the process. If you're incredibly toxic in a game, but nobody reports you, are you still flagged? What if you play completely normally, but 9 people report you, are you flagged for that? Is there a system that'll flag you for using key-words, regardless of the context of them?

Just asking out of curiosity, I understand if you want to keep your ban system processing a secret so people can't find a way to abuse it

>  If you're incredibly toxic in a game, but nobody reports you, are you still flagged?

No.

> What if you play completely normally, but 9 people report you, are you flagged for that?

No.

>  Is there a system that'll flag you for using key-words, regardless of the context of them?

There are numerous detection modules in the IFS, one of which is responsible for detecting a small number of zero-tolerance things such as hate speech. This is the most naive of the modules, since it only looks for things which should never have a place in game. Think of the hate speech module as a first pass detection to easily detect obvious things.

I see. I'm a bit confused on what the connotation is from the combined first two answers though.

So aside from set trigger words, a person can be a toxic as they want but with no reports, they will ultimately slide under the radar (which makes sense, as there are no reports to draw attention to said person).

However, if a person plays normally and receives 9 reports, how do they not get flagged?

*I mean flagged as in the sense that it appears as a case to look at in someones inbox, not that they are punished*

I think what Tantram is saying is that somebody getting 9 reports is no more flagged for review than somebody getting one report. 

We've been consistently assured that multiple reports carry no more weight than single reports.

Hmm, I did not know this. However, from my brief research into this, it seems this was stated in the context that 1 report or 5 reports from an all pre-made group are weighed equally. Which would make sense. However, if nine individuals, all stranger to each other till the game started, 4 of which are on your own team, unanimously report said individual, wouldn't it make sense to put a review of the game under more scrutiny? 

I've had friends who have reported Yasuo players just because they're tilted. And honestly, said reported Yasuo probably only got one report for that game. I'm sure there are many other games where a person just rages and decides to press the report button to make themselves feel better. Are these games put onto a lower priority than ones with higher reports on them?

From what Tantram has said in the past, if a player gets reported, their game gets reviewed. If not, then not. There's nothing more complicated at work there. 

A 9x report can mean a lot of things. I doubt 9x would happen without somebody insisting that everybody report one person, which could simply mean that it was a witch hunt. And if something was so flagrantly against the rules that all nine other players reported it, then the usual report from a single person is gonna result in a punishment anyway.

I was not able to find anyone mocking you based on your rank in this thread, so I'm not to sure about what your complaint is about. Also, not a lot of league players go to forums on a regular basis, and even less of those individuals got to the LoL forums (Reddit seems to be the most popular one right now). On top of that, this thread falls under the category of Player Behaviour, one of the less scouted boards on a daily basis by the general public, and is a thread with only 20 upvotes, titled "I am unbanned!" and is 3 days old. I'm afraid very few players are going to see your comment and act on it in the way you specify.

If you do genuinely and honestly feel that a Rioter is is purposefully misconstruing what you are saying in order to attack your character, I would suggest submitting a ticket stating the details and providing links to when and where this has occurred. 

HOWEVER, make sure you are level headed, review all the information to make sure that you aren't interpreting something in a wrong way, and only bother making a ticket as a last resort when the situation can't be resolved/is serious enough to warrant a second opinion from the company.

My outside perspective on this though, unbiased as I have no connection to you or Riot Tantram, is that you are very angry and voicing your opinion based on that anger, and that this situation is far from serious enough to warrant sending in a ticket; upon review of the situation based off of the ticket sent in, it would be too minor to warrant any action.

Your case is nothing like the OP's case. Do not compare the two.

You actively chose to use derogatory hate speech against another player, whereas the OP simply quoted somebody who was doing that and asking them why they would say it.

Context does not matter. There are more appropriate ways to express your displeasure with a person besides using hate speech. You should know better than to treat people like that regardless of the context.

If it's something you would not say openly in a public place in front of somebody who's respect you cherish, then it is not something you should say to another person over the internet.

Happy to hear the issue got resolved, but sad to hear that it took 9 days. I took note of your case and will use it as an example on our side for improvements.

I wish the spiteful champ pick wasn't there, but it still highlights an area that could use improvement.
